Merging Folder or Item Properties Automatically

To streamline the merge process with the View Comparison utility, you can use the auto-merge feature to merge folders and item properties. You need to furnish input only when conflicts exist.

For example, you will not see the File Merge dialog unless two files have conflicting changes – that is, the same property has changed in both views. If two files have the same properties or have different properties but no conflicting changes, you will not see this dialog. Similarly, you see the Visual Merge main window only if the merge file has conflicts.

To auto-merge child folders or items:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Select the appropriate tab from the lower pane of the View Comparison window.

  4. Select one or more items from the item pane.

  5. Do one of the following:

    • Select Merge Items >To Source or Merge Items >To Target from the Item or context menu.

    • Click the  Merge Items To Source button or Merge Items To Target button on the toolbar.

    The Merge Options dialog opens.

  6. (Files only) Select or clear the Merge item properties and Merge item contents check boxes, depending upon your needs. For example, you may want to retain the current file properties but save the merged contents to both the source and target views.

  7. (Files only) If you are merging the file contents, do one of the following:

    • Select the Save merged item contents to server check box to check the file in as part of the merge process.

    • Clear the Save merged item contents to server check box to save the merged contents in the source or target working folder. This allows you to test the merged file before checking it in manually.

    Note: Your most recent setting for the Save merged item contents to server check box becomes a personal option and is stored in starteam-client-options.xml.

  8. Select the Record successful merge check box to store the information needed to track merge operations.

  9. Select the Use last recorded merge check box to base the merge on the two items being merged and the Merge From item used for the last recorded merge. Otherwise, the most recent common ancestor will be used to perform a three-way merge. The common ancestor is a historical revision that has the same revision number in both views.

  10. Click OK. The Merge dialog, Visual Merge utility, and Merge File Contents dialog appear when conflicts need to be resolved.

    11. If there are no conflicts, you see only the Merge In Progress dialog, which displays a progress bar.

Tip: During the auto-merge process, the Merge dialog has a Skip button that allows you to bypass a pair of items instead of merging them.
